content: Good on you! Strange parallels and congruencies in your story with my own experience of being kicked out of the company I founded after 18 years. In my case, because I delegated investor management to my partner, who built his own bridges with the investors/board while I let mine crumble. In my defence, our investors were idiots who were wrangling amongst themselves. But that’s a poor defense, I know. But… it’s the best thing that could’ve happened to my career. It’s been six years now and I’ve partnered with the person I should’ve originally — my wife. We’ve built a business up from scratch leveraging each other’s skills and it’s more successful and way less stressful than the original was. I’m back to having fun and running a business because I want to and not because I have to. Power to you!
